channel.title: Bryan
channel.description:
Stumbled upon a chest with 3x64 diamond blocks now I'm not being funny but obvious xray is obvious? This has completely ruined the confined resources there is on this world now because someones xrayed all the diamonds and locked them in a chest which he's stumbled upon (that's the story anyway).
I think they should be removed to be honest, that's like every diamond in W2. He has 2x64 diamond blocks, 3x64 iron blocks and has developed an attitude because of it.
Also, serious problem, ban command only works if the player is online. Haven't been able to punish any of the recent players who grief.

item.title: Bryan
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Coonhunter became inactive, not sure if he removed them. There seems to be a lot of suspect duping/cheating going on here we need means to check what items people have to be honest.

Read full topic

item.title: Bryan
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Yes, I got it out of him in the end, Coonhunter has the last collection of cheated blocks. I’ll move to take them within the coming days.

I have a feeling he won’t do this peacefully.

Read full topic

item.title: Bryan
item.dc:creator: @Tarkoff Tarkoff
item.description:
@Tarkoff wrote:

Hmm.
I got a msg from Manbearpig saying that Girlmans chests that were stuck in my hallway were finally unlocked. and he gave me a block of diamond and gold and a few wool.
Were these the chests that were unlocked? Cause I could see that player doing that as they were banned for cheating.

But I don’t think that counts as all the ore in the world. I myself have 2.5 blocks of iron and 50 odd blocks of diamond. But I also use stone tools for everything and have dung some big holes.

Hard to say. found materials are just that even if they were originally acquired illegally. The Player that did cheat is banned, I dont think the player that haven’t cheated should be held responsible.

Read full topic

item.title: Bryan
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

I think they were split between coonhunter(forum name) and someone else, the same person who found them but then died and bryan got them and was suppose to split them.

Read full topic

item.title: Bryan
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

He now had a sudden change of mood and has burnt the blocks. Though this isn’t over, he still refuses to tell us other people who plundered the duped/xrayed blocks from a supposedly banned persons chests.

I also suggest Moparisthebest checks Bryans chests, he has unreasonable amounts of items/wealth as far as I’m being told. I also suspect he hasn’t burnt all the blocks and is lieing to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Bryan
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

They should be confiscated and destroyed, I wish they could be put back into the ground tho :(.

As for the ban command that has been a problem for a long time now, you can use a cracked client to log in with the name then ban it.

Read full topic
